intro: Oxydectes piptocalyx, commonly known as the narrow-leaved oxeye, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open grasslands and has narrow, linear leaves that are often hairy. Its showy yellow flowers are surrounded by white ray florets, making it a visually striking species. It is adapted to dry conditions and plays a role in supporting local pollinator populations.
